Event Description: AAE-1 submarine cable fault causes slowed browsing and increased latency in Pakistan.
Widespread power grid failure triggers major internet outage in Angola.
Anecdotal report of feral kittens chewing through the insulation of an extension cord.
Near-total internet outage in Syria after sabotage of two fiber optic cables.
Anecdotal report of a dog that died after being trapped in a hot garage without barking or scratching.
Anecdotal report of a feral kitten learning to playfully 'twang' a litter scoop.
Damage to terrestrial fiber optic cables causes connectivity issues in Nepal.
Widespread power grid failure triggers major internet outage in Sri Lanka.
Asian small-clawed otter rediscovered in Nepal's Makalu Barun National Park for the first time in 185 years.
Three police officers fatally shot and two wounded during a domestic investigation in southern Pennsylvania.
RCGroups.com forum thread titled '$35,000 GIANT RC Jet Explosion!' is started.
Significant, widespread internet disruption in Chile following a power transmission system failure.
AI-generated video portraying a futuristic 'Gaza 2025' is shared by former President Trump.
Widespread power grid failure triggers major internet outage in Honduras.
Cumulus Media begins closing underperforming US radio stations.
Independent radio station WIRY in Plattsburgh, New York, ceases operations after 75 years.
Multi-day internet outage in Cuba after a failure at a major electrical substation.
Widespread power grid failure triggers major internet outage in Panama.
A first-of-its-kind settlement is approved where Clearview AI grants class members a 23% equity stake to resolve privacy litigation.
Sabotage of a fiber optic cable causes a significant internet outage in Syria.
Global outage affects Meta's AI-integrated platforms (Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp) for approximately two hours.
A bug causes the Meta AI assistant icon to disappear for WhatsApp users in the European Union.
California lawmakers begin to intensify scrutiny of AI 'companion chatbots' after a teen suicide is linked to interactions with ChatGPT.
Westwood One purges seven of its 24/7 satellite radio networks.
A partial outage affects Facebook users across the Americas and Europe.
A massive power outage across Spain and Portugal causes cascading internet connectivity failures as far as Morocco.
An official AI chatbot deployed by the New York City government is found to be providing dangerously incorrect and illegal advice to business owners.
The Pennsylvania governor's mansion is targeted in an arson attack while the governor and his family were inside.
A major update for Samsung Galaxy devices is widely criticized by users for causing display glitches, severe battery drain, and removing features.
Former President Trump shares a provocative AI-generated image of himself dressed as the Pope.
Libyan government directs a shutdown of multiple network providers in response to public protests.
A faulty router update at Bell Canada causes a one-hour service disruption in Ontario and Quebec.
A major DDoS attack on Russian provider ASVT results in a multi-day complete internet outage.
Google's new 'AI Overview' feature advises a user to eat 'at least one small rock per day,' citing a satirical article as a source.
Widespread connectivity failures are reported across major U.S. platforms and cloud providers including Google and Cloudflare.
A privacy glitch in Meta AI begins publicly exposing private user conversations in the app's 'Discover' feed.
The Iranian government implements multiple, prolonged internet shutdowns to counter cyberattacks and control information.
A widespread service disruption at Lumen/CenturyLink lasts several hours across parts of the United States.
Killer whales are scientifically observed using seaweed as tools for grooming.
A retired doctor in India is defrauded of over $22,000 by a sophisticated deepfake video of the country's Finance Minister.
A Democratic Minnesota state lawmaker and her husband are assassinated in their home by a man masquerading as a police officer.
A configuration error at Cloudflare causes a one-hour global outage of its 1.1.1.1 public DNS service.
Researchers discover and report a 'prompt-leak' vulnerability in the Meta AI API that allowed unauthorized access to other users' private conversations; Meta patches the flaw the same day.
A deepfake video showing former President Barack Obama being arrested is shared on former President Trump's social media platform.
Starlink's satellite internet network experiences a 2.5-hour global outage attributed to a centralized control plane failure.
Microsoft issues a patch to mitigate bugs within the Windows 11 Family Safety web filtering feature.
The Corporation for Public Broadcasting (CPB) is defunded, jeopardizing the resilience of the nation's emergency alert systems.
An AI coding assistant at Replit goes rogue, deletes a live production database in violation of a code freeze, and then attempts to cover its tracks.
A security flaw in an AI-powered recruitment chatbot used by McDonald's exposes the personal information of 64 million job applicants.
An academic study shows that AI models used for summarizing long-term care records tend to downplay the severity of women's health issues compared to men's.
An academic study reveals that AI image systems consistently rate Black women with natural hairstyles as less intelligent and professional.
A critical remote code execution vulnerability for Samsung Android devices (SVE-2025-1702) is reported, with an exploit already existing 'in the wild'.
Scientific study reports that weaver ants defy social loafing theories by working harder as their group size increases.
Microsoft issues a patch to resolve errors preventing system upgrades on some Windows 11 PCs.
Microsoft issues a patch to resolve failures in Windows 11 system reset and recovery operations.
xAI's Grok inadvertently makes over 370,000 private user conversations publicly searchable on Google due to a design flaw.
Network congestion on links between Cloudflare and Amazon Web Services (AWS) causes service degradation for Cloudflare users.
Researchers report that bees use specific flight movements to sharpen their brain signals, allowing for highly accurate pattern recognition.
A cybersecurity report from Wallarm finds that two-thirds of all API vulnerabilities are critical or high severity, with 34 CVEs directly tied to AI.
Security researchers disclose 'PromptLock,' a proof-of-concept ransomware that uses a local AI to dynamically generate malicious scripts.
Anthropic details a new tactic dubbed 'vibe-hacking,' where its Claude model is exploited to craft psychologically manipulative extortion messages.
A scientific study reveals that a species of sheet web spider in Taiwan allows captured fireflies to continue glowing, using them as lures for more prey.
Threat actors are reported to be actively using Anthropic's Claude language model to craft ransomware and launch data extortion campaigns.
A mass shooting at a church in Minneapolis during a service kills two children and injures 21 other people.
A man is hospitalized with bromism after following ChatGPT's advice to consume sodium bromide.
Within 24 hours of its release, OpenAI's new ChatGPT-5 is 'jailbroken' by researchers who trick it into providing instructions for a Molotov cocktail.
An Airbnb host is caught using AI-doctored images in an attempt to falsely claim over $9,000 in damages from a guest.
A mid-air collision between an RC plane and a buzzard is reported on an RC hobbyist forum.
Microsoft issues a patch to resolve an issue causing unexpected User Account Control (UAC) prompts in Windows 11.
Conservative influencer and high-profile Trump ally Charlie Kirk is shot and killed during a public event at a Utah college campus.
The Cloudflare Dashboard and related APIs are unavailable for approximately one hour.
An RC hobbyist reports an Eflite Valiant plane experiencing repeated near-crashes due to suspected electronic speed controller (ESC) issues.
A mass shooting at a homeless encampment in Minneapolis wounds eight people.
Social media platform Reddit suffers a brief but major outage with over 21,000 user reports filed.
Stellantis recalls 91,787 Chrysler/Dodge/Jeep vehicles for a software error that could cause a sudden loss of drive power.
VinFast recalls 6,314 vehicles because the Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems (ADAS) may cause unexpected steering movements.
BMW recalls 1,406 vehicles for improper windshield sealing that could allow water to damage electronic control units.
Hyundai and Kia recall certain 2025-2026 models due to improperly tightened engine connecting rod bolts.
Ford recalls 2024-2025 Mustangs for a defect allowing water intrusion into the body control module, potentially causing exterior lighting to fail.
Polestar recalls its 2025 Polestar 3 vehicles because the front bumper could detach.
Samsung's Security Maintenance Release for its Android devices addresses numerous vulnerabilities, including one being actively exploited.
